programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts visit an ancient fortress in Peru believed to have been built by aliens using tools far more advanced than those thought to have been available to humans at the time.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick restores a piece of playground equipment from a 1970s McDonald's and a portable record player.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.sub-title: David Copperfield: Rick Works His Magic
programme.desc: Illusionist David Copperfield calls on the staff to restore two items from his magic museum's collection, so Rick Dale and his team set out to complete the work for a profit.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Pawn Stars' Rick Dale and his team take delivery of a unique scale model of a 1932 Hudson car, embarking on a museum-quality makeover.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick and his team restore a vintage arcade boxing game.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank visit rural Minnesota, where they meet antiques collectors and examine vintage peep show machines.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Part one of two. The lumberjacks have limited time to reach their targets. Conner Aviation battles for survival while at Pihl, one man does not last the week.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Part two of two. Last-minute problems send the competition down to the wire as the season comes to a close. The men of Pihl have a disagreement, and Conner has to deal with defeat.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick restores a famous car featured in the James Bond movie The Spy who Loved Me.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Ron agrees to a controversial deal, and Rick restores a 1960s motorcycle.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: In 2008, the UK's Ministry of Defence released decades' worth of classified UFO files to the public. One month later, UFO hysteria ripped through the country. Here, the team probes some of the largest sightings of alleged UFOs ever recorded over the English Channel, including two eerie bright-yellow flat objects spotted by pilots in 2007.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: An investigation into an unusual object spotted over Chicago's O'Hare International Airport in 2006, asking whether aliens are watching Earth's aviation industry.

programme.title: Air Crash: Disasters Uncovered
programme.desc: An inquiry reveals the shocking truth about why two trains crashed in the Rocky Mountains, and leads to revelations about those who run Canada's freight trains.

programme.title: Mega Disasters
programme.desc: Experts consider the possible effects of an eruption of the volcano in Yellowstone Park in America, which could lead to starvation, epidemics and social chaos.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Danielle search through a scrapyard and a 19th-century ghost town, and find a classic car with a famous Hollywood history.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank find what seems to be a dinosaur bone, and ask the curators of the Museum of Natural Science to verify whether or not it is real.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les gets excited over a jar of powdered gold as he believes it is worth a lot of money, and an explosive acid test is poised to reveal all.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Series following colourful life in a large pawn shop. From alligators to false limbs, its staff has no idea what could come through the door next, and profits come with a huge risk. Thursday.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Pawnbroker Les Gold and his two children, Seth and Ashley, operate Detroit's largest pawnshop. From alligators to false limbs, its staff has no idea what could come through the door next, and profits come with a huge risk..

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A threatening customer puts the store on a high alert, while Ashley and Seth bet on whether a stripper's pole will sell.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The Golds clash over whether they should be armed after Les's confrontation with a customer, and Ashley fails to close a deal.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The Golds clash when a man brings in an angry pet alligator he wants rid of. Les has to keep his composure to avoid making a bad decision.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: The Man in Black Is Back in Black
programme.desc: Dave Hester returns to the auction circuit, Darrell tries to get Brandon into shape, and Jarrod and Brandi's latest purchase leads them on a wild ride.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: The Return of the Mogul's Return
programme.desc: Jarrod goes bidding with a hangover which Brandi fears will hold him back, while Dave will not let a fight with Laura keep him away from an auction.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell tries to learn more about the mysterious Mogul, Jarrod and Brandi try not to let Dave distract them, and Ivy makes a find that leads to an adventure on the high seas.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell and Brandon return to a town where they have always enjoyed good luck in the past - but this time, Dave is the one who comes out on top.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: Deep in the Heart of Upland
programme.desc: A surprise visitor from Texas attends the latest heated round of auctions, which goes badly for the bidders but ends in a spectacular climax.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Dan and Laura have a crisis on their hands, and Brandi tries to make sure Jarrod focuses on the auctions.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell and Brandon experience the sweet taste of success, Mary looks for love and Jarrod and Brandi return to Moreno Valley.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Dan Dotson returns to the auctions in Costa Mesa, California, where the buyers have their sights set on rival Dave Hester on his home turf.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Buyers Darrell, Brandon, Jarrod, Brandi and Ivy head to El Monte, California, where they tackle the local competition head-on.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers head to the hills of Murrieta for an auction that has tensions and prices running high. Dave drives Darrell to breaking-point.

programme.title: Forged in Fire
programme.desc: After two challenging rounds of signature crafting, two bladesmiths are tasked with recreating a beautiful but deadly Indonesian sword, the kelewang.

programme.title: The Curse of Oak Island
programme.desc: While an incredible new discovery is made at Smith's Cove, brothers Marty and Rick Lagina and their team make a find at the Money Pit that could be part of the fabled Oak Island treasure.

programme.title: Swamp People
programme.desc: Troy and Guy stalk what could be their biggest gator of the season, while Jay Paul makes a bad call that could cost him and his dad big bucks.

programme.title: Mountain Men
programme.desc: Morgan's first flight over the peaks leaves him in a dead skid over the edge, Marty fights to double down on a big payday, while Eustace bites off more than he can chew to get the job done. Jason takes River on a mountain rite of passage.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Topical comedy show, with Ellie Taylor, Josh Widdicombe, Rob Beckett and James Acaster joining regulars Hugh Dennis and Andy Parsons to give their irreverent takes on the biggest stories to hit the headlines hit the headlines in October 2015, through stand-up spots and improvised games. Chaired by Dara O Briain.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Former MP and Strictly Come Dancing star Ed Balls hosts an extended edition of the current affairs quiz, with broadcaster Janet Street-Porter and comedian Henning Wehn joining regular team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the week's events.

programme.title: Dave Gorman: Modern Life Is Goodish
programme.sub-title: If You Put A Sausage In It, It's Not A Viennetta
programme.desc: The comedian explores the perils of stock photography, and enlists the help of his favourite celebrity in conducting an experiment.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee thinks the twins are too young to be taught about sex at school and that their teacher Miss Anstis is too stuck up to teach it. He resolves that it is his duty as a father to teach his children everything he knows about the facts of life, discovering only when it is too late that his knowledge is somewhat limited. Comedy, starring Lee Mack and Sally Bretton.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: When Charlie's school gets a bad Ofsted rating, Lee and Lucy start looking around for alternative schools. Despite Frank's protests, Geoffrey and Wendy offer to pay to send Charlie to be privately educated, which presents Lee and Lucy with a moral dilemma.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee interrupts Lucy's favourite TV programme by plonking himself down next to her on the sofa, eating her chocolates and talking loudly all the way through the dialogue. But when he suddenly can't remember the name of the leading actor and his hypochondria tells him he is losing his memory, Lucy's evening is completely ruined.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Jay Leno's Garage
programme.desc: Jay and Jeff Dunham race some fast amphibious cars, before Jay boards a huge Navy hovercraft.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May travel to America for an interstate road trip, completing various challenges along the way. Starting in Miami, they each buy a car for less than $1,000 and drive to New Orleans, where they set out to give their vehicles away to people who suffered in Hurricane Katrina.

programme.title: Ultimate Movers
programme.desc: A Second World War anti-aircraft gun must be deconstructed on the island of Hoy, and a new concept in floating homes is sent hundreds of miles to York.

programme.title: Mega Air
programme.desc: A closer look at one of the most bizarre air freighters on the planet, the bulbous Airbus Beluga. The programme also charts the misfortunes of an American classic car enthusiast.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: A man calls 999 claiming his car has been stolen, but when the vehicle turns up crashed into a wall with cans of cider in the footwell, James is suspicious to say the least.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: Keith gets lost on the roads of Derbyshire looking for a wanted man. He spots a dodgy van driver who is on the road without insurance, and is forced to make a crucial decision.

programme.title: Ultimate Movers
programme.desc: The largest big-top circus tent in the UK needs to move town, but with 22 artic lorries to fill with gear, the teams need to work late into the night to stay on schedule.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Coverage of the international event from London's Alexandra Palace in which amateur drivers race home-made, engineers vehicles. Over the years, vehicles have ranged from a piano to a giant baby carriage, and the latest contenders include C-17 Roadmaster, Braking Badly, Poldark Express and Turbo Tugboat.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.sub-title: Would I Lie to You? - The Unseen Bits
programme.desc: A compilation of unseen material from this series of the comedy panel show hosted by Rob Brydon. Team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by celebrity guests to dupe their opponents with plausible lies, featuring contestants including Ronnie Corbett, Bernard Cribbins, Richard E Grant, Jack Dee, Martin Clunes, Julian Clary and Sanjeev Bhaskar.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Rob Brydon hosts the comedy panel show, with regular team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack joined by Rebecca Front, Jack Whitehall, Nick Hewer and Miranda Hart, who try to deceive their opponents with plausible lies and absurd facts about themselves.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by guests Robert Webb, Terry Wogan, Katy Wix and Kevin Bridges on the panel show. Rob Brydon chairs as the contestants try to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves.

programme.title: Eddie Eats America
programme.desc: Eddie gets a taste of Cuba in Miami's fresh seafood, sets his sights at a shooting range, and heads cross-state to attempt a huge surf & turf challenge created just for him.

programme.title: Eddie Eats America
programme.desc: Stoke strongman Eddie Hall visits cosmopolitan Queens, NY, to make a solo attempt at a huge Greek kebab banquet, sample the best Chinese dumplings and try his hand at baseball.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: A car that had failed to stop then reverses at speed down a footpath, hitting the door of a police car. Officers assist security guards in a tower block by removing two women.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Jenny Eclair, Johnny Vegas and Bill Bailey join regular panellist Alan Davies for an extended edition of the quiz show, in which Stephen Fry awards points for the answers he finds most interesting - regardless of whether they are correct. This time, the Stephen Fry prepares for the festive period with some seasonal merriment.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Former MP and Strictly Come Dancing star Ed Balls hosts an extended edition of the current affairs quiz, with broadcaster Janet Street-Porter and comedian Henning Wehn joining regular team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the week's events.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Topical comedy show, with Rob Beckett, Ed Byrne, Milton Jones, Romesh Ranganathan and Holly Walsh joining Dara O Briain and Hugh Dennis to take a comic look at recent world events, through stand-up and improvised games. First shown in October 2015.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Greg Davies challenges Hugh Dennis to wield a blade, while Mel Giedroyc destroys a mannequin. Alex Horne helps coax the contestants.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Panellists David Mitchell, Bill Bailey, Phill Jupitus and Alan Davies tackle questions about China, Corby and coffee, with points going to the answers host Stephen Fry finds the most interesting.

programme.title: Steam Train Britain
programme.desc: Ffestiniog and Welsh Highland Railway are celebrating their annual Victorian Weekend, while in south Devon, silver service waiter Andy Leech runs the three-course Sunday lunch.

programme.title: Trains That Changed the World
programme.desc: The railroads ended slavery in the USA, but trains can be agents of oppression too. The British Empire built railways to rule the world, enabling it to control the empire.

programme.title: Slow Train Through Africa with Griff Rhys Jones
programme.desc: The comedian begins the next leg of his trip in Kasama, northern Zambia. His first stop is the town of Mpika, where he meets college students training to be locomotive drivers. Next, in the capital Lusaka, he reveals how the first railways were built to access the country's rich mineral wealth, and watches craftsmen cutting emeralds and rubies - before being let loose on a pair of bejewelled cufflinks. Griff then reaches the spectacular Victoria Falls on his way to Zimbabwe's second-largest city, Bulawayo.

programme.title: History's Ultimate Spies
programme.desc: After the death of Cardinal Wolsey in 1530, Thomas Cromwell became Henry VIII's 'lap dog'. In order to do the king's bidding, he established a network of spies that steered Henry through his troubles with Rome, divorces, assassinations attempts and the establishment of a new religion. as this documentary reveals, though cunning and ambitious, none of these achievements proved sufficient to preserve his life.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Slow Train Through Africa with Griff Rhys Jones
programme.desc: The comedian makes five train journeys taking in the spectacular sights of Africa, travelling to unexpected places in deserts and forests, villages and cities, and finding out how the railways are used today. On the fourth leg of his journey across the continent, Griff travels across Namibia in the south-west, experiencing luxury camping, encountering cheetahs, and visiting 1,000-foot sand dunes.

programme.title: History's Ultimate Spies
programme.desc: As a Protestant, Queen Elizabeth I lived with the threat of assassination from Catholics throughout her reign. Thankfully, there was an army of men available to work in secret under spy master Francis Walsingham with the sole aim of protecting her. As this documentary reveals, Walsingham was able to demonstrate remarkable cunning in his role.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The sabotaging efforts of Peugeot in Nazi-occupied France, where the bosses and workers cooperated closely with the Resistance to hinder the use of military vehicles by the Nazis.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The story of America's ‘Liberty Ships', which were produced in incredible numbers and became known as the Model T Fords of the ocean.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The remarkable story of how Stalin's massive war factories were dismantled and moved east on one and half million railway trucks, to avoid being lost to the Nazis.

programme.title: Hitler's England
programme.desc: Former Bergerac star John Nettles returns to Jersey to tell the story of the British Channel Islands under German occupation from 1940 to 1945.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: Documentary uncovering and examining hidden structures built by the Nazis, from tunnels to towers, artillery sites, resistance nests and communication centres. The first edition focuses on the Channel Island of Guernsey, which Hitler occupied and fortified over the course of five years.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: Nicholas Day investigates the murder committed by Ruth Ellis, the last woman to be hanged in Britain whose case divided the nation.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: The crimes of Scottish serial killer Peter Manuel, who murdered at least eight people between 1956 and 1958 in the Greater Glasgow area.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: Dramatised account of 19th-century serial killer Mary Ann Cotton, aka the Black Widow, who travelled around the north east of England, and murdered men for the life insurance.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: Nicholas Day investigates the murder committed by Ruth Ellis, the last woman to be hanged in Britain whose case divided the nation.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: The crimes of Scottish serial killer Peter Manuel, who murdered at least eight people between 1956 and 1958 in the Greater Glasgow area.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: Dramatised account of 19th-century serial killer Mary Ann Cotton, aka the Black Widow, who travelled around the north east of England, and murdered men for the life insurance.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A town in West Virginia that fell victim to the pace of change when steam trains became obsolete and an underground complex in Italy that had been abandoned for nearly 2,000 years.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: The British airmen are captured while paddling down the estuary, so Rene and the Resistance launch a cunning plan to rescue them - using a couple of coffins.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: Herr Flick and Von Smallhausen prepare to meet their maker as they face a firing squad, while Madame Fanny discovers Edith in bed with the Fuehrer.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: Von Klinkerhoffen orders Rene and Edith to dress up as Hitler and Goering pretending to leave town so he can catch any Resistance group that tries to attack them. Meanwhile, Michelle plans to swap an eel containing the Fallen Madonna for a dog fish containing 10 million French francs.

programme.title: Queen Elizabeth's Secret Agents
programme.desc: A look at the secret network behind Queen Elizabeth I's 40-year reign and the world's first secret service run by her spymasters Robert and William Cecil..

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: A secret weapons program in the heart of Austria that could have ended badly for the Allies - and may have indicated nuclear plans being concocted by Hitler.

programme.title: The Heart Guy
programme.desc: Jarrod's new job offer could mean Penny will leave Whyhope for ever - but is this what Hugh really wants?.

programme.title: A Place to Call Home
programme.desc: Sarah arrives in Paris, hoping to reconnect with her husband, and is shocked by what she finds. Elizabeth pushes George to be truthful, but causes more damage to their already fragile relationship. Regina puts the next stage of her plan into action, and while Anna finds out the truth about her real father, Olivia proves the depths she is prepared to go to in order to save her marriage.

programme.title: A Place to Call Home
programme.desc: Sarah returns to Inverness with Rene, but may have underestimated her feelings for George. Olivia finds the burden of deception weighs heavily, while Anna and Gino prepare for their wedding day.

programme.title: A Place to Call Home
programme.desc: Rene suspects he is standing in the way of Sarah's happiness after witnessing a moment of yearning, while Andrew disturbs Anna and Gino's honeymoon bliss. Elsewhere, George makes an announcement.

programme.title: Boon
programme.desc: Ken and Harry pose as conference organisers in a bid to prove the innocence of a former head of security at a leading hotel, while Rocky and Alex carry out an elaborate burglary.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: Part two of two. While in Venice investigating his friend's death, Lovejoy discovers that not only is the beautiful Caterina saving art for herself rather than posterity, but so too is her sister Lavinia. Fulton Mackay, Gwen Humble and Haydn Gwynne guest star, with Ian McShane.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part one of two. The bomb attack on the summer party leaves Adam hovering on the brink of death, and while Tony valiantly risks his own life to rescue his stricken superior, Lance's reluctance to put himself in danger causes him to question his future in the force. Jack's ex-lover Rachel Heath claims he is the father of her baby son and begs him to help retrieve him from the clutches of a religious fanatic, while Gina wonders how to tell Jonathan just how she feels about him.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part two of two. Sheelagh reacts with disgust when Lance suggests Conor may have been behind the bombing - until a shocking discovery compels her to reassess her relationship with her son. Andrea's return to the station prompts Neil to cast aside all restraint, and eager new CID recruit Gary Best goes missing during an undercover assignment, forcing Ken and Rob to embark on a desperate hunt for him. Jack declares his love for Rachel, and it seems Adam could be heading for a court appearance when he refuses to retract his allegations about Jerome Taylor.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Struggling to come to terms with Conor's revelation about his sexuality, Sheelagh tries to build bridges with him - only to be floored by another shocking discovery. Irene Radford is implicated in an arson attack on an ice cream van, but it seems she will escape justice yet again when the van owner dies in suspicious circumstances. Jack angrily dismisses Debbie's concerns about his relationship with Rachel, but she refuses to take a hint and arranges a set-up to catch her out.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: As Rob and Ken set out on the trail of warring factions the Hambilton Massive and Copthorne Crew, Kerry accepts a risky undercover assignment in a bid to help them nail local crime family the Radfords. Ramani returns to CSU and is appalled by the way Phil Hunter has handled things in her absence, while Rachel exacts a violent revenge on Martin Grainger, convinced he was responsible for telling Jack about her continuing involvement in the vice trade.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: The Snows battle on with life, knowing it will never be the same again without Peggy, but at least a little light relief is on the horizon in the form of the school production of The Wizard of Oz. Meanwhile, Dick and Cheryl finally get through to adopted son Oscar, who has been more of a handful than they ever expected. Rural drama, starring Lesley Dunlop and Tony Haygarth.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Henry and Jess' meal together proves productive, Simon and Anna go out on a date and Karen worries about an elderly patient's grand-daughter. Drama about community nurses living and working in a small Yorkshire town, starring Lesley Dunlop and Leslie Ash.

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: The duo help reorganise the seed museum owned by the descendants of famous botanist Edwin Pargeter - but it is not long before a man is found dead in the family's garden. In an effort to trace his killer, Rosemary involves colleagues from the Royal Horticultural Society at Kew Gardens, and soon the race is on to identify a batch of mysterious seeds before it falls into the wrong hands. Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris star.

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: The duo are invited to help create an Arabian-style garden in Malaga. Before long, a local resident is found dead, and a mysterious landowner is the chief suspect. When it transpires that someone has blocked the mountainside channels on which the new garden will rely for its supply of water, it appears the precious commodity may provide a motive for the killing. Mystery drama, starring Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: With the advent of a mass X-ray programme to diagnose tuberculosis early, Dr Turner is determined that Poplar will no longer live under the threat of the disease. Meanwhile, Jenny's district nursing rounds lead her to the Mastersons, who suffered devastating misfortune from TB, and she works to reconcile the dying father with his only remaining daughter, Julia. Having succeeded in securing a visit from a screening van, Dr Turner and the midwives endure a busy day, but little can prepare them for what the results will mean for one of their own. Guest starring Karl Johnson (Lark Rise to Candleford).

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Cynthia's district nursing rounds find her tending a diabetic man who turns out to be a terrible bully to his wife, while Jenny looks after a black mother-to-be being subjected to racial prejudice from her neighbours. Nonnatus House prepares for the return of Chummy from Sierra Leone - but she has her own surprise. Miranda Hart, Jessica Raine and Bryony Hannah star.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: There's a buzz of excitement at Nonnatus House as Chummy and Peter prepare for the arrival of their baby, Fred has a visit from his pregnant daughter and Jenny's love life is looking up when she is introduced to a potential new gentleman friend. However, change is in the air in Poplar and soon the friends are forced to stand together as their home comes under threat. Jessica Raine, Miranda Hart, Cliff Parisi, Ben Caplan and Pam Ferris star.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Brian struggles to control his urge to drink and finds refuge in a commune at the centre of the team's investigation into the death of a university student. The case also helps Gerry to face up to his relationship with Emily - who has not spoken to him since she discovered the truth about the DNA test at Ricky Hanson's trial. Police drama, starring Alun Armstrong and Amanda Redman.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Jack and Strickland form an unlikely alliance that sees them break the rules to find out why a British soldier died while taking part in a Ministry of Defence medical trial. With three of the man's colleagues now suffering from psychological, drink or memory problems, the team considers whether he died as a result of the experiment, or if he was a victim of a cover-up by the Army.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The team discovers a link between a mummified body and a Notting Hill house that featured as the location for a murderous fight between gangsters in a 1960s film, and present-day renovation work reveals more skeletons behind the walls. Spencer complicates matters further by revealing he lived there with his family when the events must have taken place. Crime drama, starring Trevor Eve, Sue Johnston and Holly Aird.

programme.title: I'm a Celebrity Get Me Out of Here!
programme.sub-title: I'm a Celebrity Get Me Out of Here! Coming Out
programme.desc: Just a few days after the new King or Queen of the jungle was crowned, Ant and Dec present the usual round-up of what happened behind the scenes as each campmate was voted out. From the first to the last, the programme reveals what they get up to in their first few days of freedom, and captures their reactions to old rivals and trusted friends, while their families gather for emotional reunions with their loved ones.

programme.title: Animal Mums
programme.desc: How animals raise their young, revealing how elephants and vervet monkeys will work together to look after all the youngsters in a social group. The programme also features a lioness with eight boisterous cubs and sheep farmers who reveal how lambs learn to recognise their mothers' voices, reveals how gannets and seals find their way back to their offspring, and demonstrates some bad behaviour among young goats and orangutans.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Thunderbirds Are Go
programme.desc: When a mining vehicle breaks down on planet Mercury, Brains must get it working before sunrise.

programme.title: Dare Master
programme.desc: Danny goes extreme window cleaning, but will he be brave enough to abseil down the building and avoid the forfeit?.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: The hapless bumbler goes on a one-man mission to clean up the town after becoming furious with the state of the streets and all the people who drop litter. Chaotic cartoon capers following the further adventures of the popular halfwit immortalised in the live-action TV series and Hollywood films. With the voice of Rowan Atkinson.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: The hapless bumbler tries to retrieve his credit card from a cash dispenser, but ends up trapped in a bank vault. With the voice of Rowan Atkinson.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Fizz and Weasel set up their super-antenna in the desert. Magoo ends up beside them. He mistakes the antenna for a forest's last oak tree..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Hidden inside a robot, Fizz and Weasel hack the world's Internet server, but Magoo, shopping the sales, mistakes it for a shopping cart and takes it..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Fizz is recording chill music to de-stress the world, so he needs quiet. Unluckily, Magoo's come over to borrow a wrench and thinks there's a leak..

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: Monsters and ghouls get in the way of the Scooby gang's adventures as they travel and spend time together in the summer.

programme.title: Robozuna
programme.desc: Children's sci-fi fantasy series about 14-year-old orphan Ariston and his robot Mangle, fighting an evil empire together.

programme.title: Spy School
programme.desc: Spy-themed game show in which two friends work together to foil the plans of evil mastermind Goldfist. The world is in peril as Goldfist's plan to create a super-size pet monster are revealed, so the cadets head to the Natural History Museum before he can extract the animal DNA needed to create his Gold-zilla.

programme.title: Beautiful Baking with Juliet Sear
programme.desc: The baker makes rosemary and parmesan shortbreads, and charcoal Christmas tree crackers for cheese. Plus, Paul A Young makes his rum butter chocolate brownies.

programme.title: John and Lisa's Weekend Kitchen
programme.desc: John Torode and Lisa Faulkner reveal their take on classic festive dishes, including the perfect turkey, roast potatoes, and a classic Christmas cake.

programme.title: Nadia's Family Feasts
programme.desc: Nadia Sawalha creates an American-themed meal with Christian Stevenson - aka DJ BBQ. On the menu are Maryland home fries for breakfast, buttermilk fried chicken for lunch, Christian's Smash Burger and tomato pie for dinner, with Nadia's Washington apple crisp for dessert.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby and Jones investigate when the body of a woman is pulled from the river during the local Oak Apple carnival. Closer inspection suggests the drowning was deliberate - and, as the detectives find out more about the villagers, they learn the killing could be linked to the death of the victim's daughter eight years previously. John Nettles and Jason Hughes play the intrepid policemen, with guest star Simon Callow.

programme.title: The Mummy (1999)
programme.desc: A soldier of fortune joins an academic and her conniving brother on an expedition to an ancient Egyptian lost city. The explorers accidentally cause the spirit of a vengeful priest with awe-inspiring supernatural powers to rise from his tomb, leading to a desperate battle for survival. Fantasy action adventure, starring Brendan Fraser, Rachel Weisz, John Hannah, Arnold Vosloo and Oded Fehr.

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as TV presenter David Grant, Paralympian Jonnie Peacock, TV doctor Pixie McKenna and comedian Andy Hamilton pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: Elf (2003)
programme.desc: A child is taken in by kind-hearted Santa and raised as an elf - so it comes as a shock when he discovers years later that he is in fact human. Deciding to get back to his roots, he heads off for New York in search of his long-lost family, but is ill-prepared for the hustle and bustle of the Big Apple. Fantasy comedy, starring Will Ferrell, James Caan, Zooey Deschanel and Edward Asner.

programme.title: The X Factor: The Band
programme.sub-title: The X Factor: The Band - Live Final
programme.desc: The remaining hopefuls take to the stage in the hope of impressing the audience at home and the panel of judges one last time. Groups discovered on The X Factor have sold more than 400 million records. Now Simon Cowell is looking for undiscovered talent to form the next big pop group to sign to his record label and follow in the footsteps of One Direction, Fifth Harmony or Little Mix in The X Factor: The Band. Only one group can ultimately be crowned champion, but who will it be?.

programme.title: Rogue One: A Star Wars Story (2016)
programme.desc: In a galaxy far, far away, Jyn Erso - the maverick daughter of scientist Galen Erso - joins the Rebel Alliance. On the planet Scarif, she and the freedom fighters, including a blind warrior and a deadpan droid, attempt to steal plans for the Death Star, a battle station capable of destroying entire worlds, which was designed by her father on behalf of the Empire. However, the Rebels face tough competition from Imperial warlord Orson Krennic and shadowy forces, including Darth Vader, who will come to play a major part in the rise of the Empire. Star Wars prequel set before the events of A New Hope, starring Felicity Jones, Diego Luna and Ben Mendelsohn.

programme.desc: Zara Larsson invites us in for a Nordic but Nice Swedish Noel complete with gingerbread, Christmas gnomes, and all the best festive tracks from Elton, Ariana and of course, Mariah.

programme.title: All The Hits, All Night
programme.desc: Non-stop hits to see you all the way through the night.

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: Bruce Crompton hopes to make a handsome profit by selling some of the long-forgotten treasures that lie around his cluttered warehouse.

programme.title: The Unexplained Files
programme.desc: Three lighthouse keepers mysteriously disappear from an island, and Russian police are handed a mummified baby that appears to be an alien.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: A 1937 Packard Convertible catches Wayne Carini's eye as he looks around an auction of unusual vehicles.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Car restorer Wayne Carini fears a contact may have something to hide when he refuses to send photographs of some high-end classics he has on offer.

programme.title: World's Deadliest Drivers
programme.desc: More than 50 million people are injured every year on the roads, sparking a boom in dashboard cameras that capture a wealth of fascinating and surprising footage.

programme.title: World's Deadliest Drivers
programme.desc: More than 50 million people are injured every year on the roads, sparking a boom in dashboard cameras that capture a wealth of fascinating and surprising footage.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: A naval pilot bales out of a plane moments before crashing, two men outrun a destructive mudslide, and a tornado lifts cars into the air. Presented by Ron Pitts.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: The driver of a modified drag boat almost loses his life, two storm chasers are trapped by a tornado, a famous bridge disintegrates and a military plane crashes spectacularly.

programme.title: Airplane Repo
programme.desc: Kevin poses as an interviewer to gain access to a Westwind jet, Ken and Danny valet a car to get the keys to a Cessna CJ3, and Mike repos an air ambulance.

programme.title: Overhaulin' Chronicles
programme.desc: The team restore the VW of a mechanic whose health has made his project come to a halt. He will get the experience of a lifetime working alongside the crew.

programme.title: James May: The Reassembler
programme.desc: The presenter continues in his quest to understand everyday objects by putting them back together again, this time reassembling the 147 pieces of an electric guitar. James' task will entail soldering, extensive use of his precision Japanese screwdrivers, and some fiddly electronics, before he attempts to channel Brian May in a solo performance.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien discover items including baby scales, an oil can and a glass cabinet that are ready for upcycling to turn a profit for their owners.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard heads to a manor house in Oxfordshire, where the classic exterior hides a weird and wonderful interior in which he hopes to uncover some priceless gems.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: Bitesize
programme.desc: In Derbyshire, Drew Pritchard finds a rare masterpiece in an attic, and he meets a collector in a converted chapel in Yorkshire. Later, in Harrogate, he finds a special antique.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: The Restorers
programme.desc: Skilled craftspeople are bringing Drew Pritchard's finds back to life. With demanding customers and high turnover, their hard work turns trash to treasure.

programme.title: EFL on Quest
programme.desc: A round-up of goals and highlights from the English Football League, including West Bromwich Albion v Birmingham City and Swansea City v Middlesbrough.

programme.title: Snooker: Scottish Open
programme.desc: The best moments from the semi-finals in Glasgow.

programme.title: Live Snooker: Scottish Open
programme.desc: The afternoon session on day seven of the ranking tournament, which comes from the Emirates Arena in Glasgow, featuring the opening frames of the final.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer seeks to get his hands on an expensive BMW 2002tii, and if he is to stay on budget, he must take a gamble on a model that has not been started for 17 years.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer heads to America in search of a Dodge Charger for expert mechanic Edd China to restore, but the hefty price tag attached to such a famous car could be a problem if the pair are to succeed in selling it on at a profit.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Edd China continues work on the Mercedes. Jobs remaining before the car can be resold by Mike Brewer include fitting a set of tyres and a new exhaust.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: The Restorers
programme.desc: Skilled craftspeople are bringing Drew Pritchard's finds back to life. With demanding customers and high turnover, their hard work turns trash to treasure.

programme.title: Live Snooker: Scottish Open
programme.desc: The evening session on day seven of the ranking tournament, which comes from the Emirates Arena in Glasgow, featuring the concluding frames of the final.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The experts take on the challenges of restoring three cherished family heirlooms, bringing back to life a Victorian cuckoo clock, a 1970s bowl and a 200-year-old sea chest.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Painting conservator Lucia Scalisi faces a serious challenge when presented with a perforated painting by celebrated British artist Fred Appleyard.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard visits one of his favourite houses and discovers a design classic, and later visits a museum in a giant windmill.

programme.title: Son of Sam: The Hunt for a Killer
programme.desc: Part two of two. American serial killer David Berkowitz, who eventually pleaded guilty to eight separate shooting attacks that began in New York City during the summer of 1976. Surviving victims, families of the deceased, and the detectives who worked on the case recount their stories.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Plants help provide oxygen and nutrients, but in a criminal investigation, they can also mark the time and location of a person's death.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The case of Susan Casey. When she disappeared, CCTV footage revealed three likely suspects on the scene. However, it was impossible to tell who was responsible until a video demonstrated that someone was lying.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The July 1999 murders of Diana Algar and her friend Jose Molina. Three letters scrawled across Algar's living room wall offered a key clue in a US-wide manhunt. Two drifters who Auger had allowed to lodge in her Pennsylvania home were later found guilty of the crime.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: A state trooper is shot after pulling over a van. Officers apprehend the culprit and discover weapons in the man's vehicle.

programme.title: Animal Cops Phoenix
programme.desc: The members of the Emergency Animal Medical Technician team in Phoenix have their work cut out as they rescue and care for animals in trouble.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Chris Brown has an all-night marathon in a canine maternity ward, and a rabbit is hit with a bad case of heatstroke.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Zabrina looks for an extravagant ball gown for her wedding, while Cheryl is nervous about seeing her custom dress for the first time.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Krystle is getting married to baseball player Ryan Howard and wants to find the perfect dress, while Southern belle Deshae looks for something with glitz, beads and sparkle.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: A bride who has recovered from cancer prepares to get married, but has to contend with her future mother-in-law. Another customer hopes her fiance will be impressed by her dress.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Chris Brown is under pressure to save a kitten that is barely alive after a freak accident at home. A dog is also brought in after being attacked by a burglar.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Chris Brown comes up with an unusual treatment for an albino rat struggling to breathe. Other members of the team deal with an angry alligator.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: The story of 42-year-old Angel, who is struggling to make a positive change and be an active part of her partner and son's lives.

programme.title: My 600lb Life: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc: A medical emergency threatens Pauline's weight loss progress, and Chay's life takes a dramatic new direction.

programme.title: My Cat from Hell
programme.desc: Behaviourist Jackson Galaxy investigates the felines of Ryann and Derek, who do not get along - Buddy has resorted to being a full time bully to the more placid Lita. Plus, everything goes smoothly between two flatmates until one gets a cat named Princess Puffy Pants, which urinates on everything.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Bride-to-be Jessica has fallen head-over-heels for a dress outside of her budget, but will she be willing to compromise?.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Susan's family travels from New York to see her dress, while Suzanne brings along her soon-to-be mother-in-law, who she is meeting for the third time.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Bride-to-be Jennifer clashes with her mother over the dress budget, while Kate has a crisis involving a curved band of fabric.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Nicole has flown in on a private jet with her family to go shopping at the salon - and money is no object in the search for a couture gown.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Featuring Sarah, a plus-size bride who has tried on nearly 20 unsatisfactory dresses, and Sofia, who wants to lose more than a stone for her big day.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Brooke tells Dianne and Randy that her budget is $7,000, leading to an awkward conversation when her mother reveals it is actually $4,000

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Pageant queen Kristi searches for a dress that will keep all eyes on her, while there is a surprise in store for wannabe bride Sarah.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Amanda finds a dress that tops the one she has already purchased at another shop, while consultant Keasha helps Brooke become a Kleinfeld bride.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Daisy tries on a dress that is twice her budget, while Donna is overwhelmed by her father's generosity.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Sarah and Diane help find matching dresses for two brides marrying each other, while Amy returns for her fitting.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Randy Fenoli helps find a dress for Lauren that will also get her opinionated family's approval, while Sharon discovers an unexpected bargain.

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.sub-title: Behind the Scenes of Knock & Shock
programme.desc: Theresa Caputo provides a unique insight into the making of Long Island Medium's Live Knock & Shock show, including backstage mishaps and and ingenious disguises.

programme.title: Crikey! It's the Irwins
programme.desc: The family go to South Africa to continue Steve's global conservation dream. Terri helps release a wild leopard, while Bindi meets an all-female anti-poaching team.

programme.title: Long Lost Family US
programme.desc: Identical twins enlist Lisa's help to unlock the mystery of why they were placed for adoption. Chris acts on a deceased father's wish to find his son..

programme.title: I Almost Got Away with It
programme.desc: ...Women On The Run. Female ex-fugitives Kaysie Dudley, Brenda Wynn, and Juanita Liebman, recount how they committed violent crimes and then tried to out-run the police..

programme.title: The Killer in My Family
programme.desc: Relatives of serial killer Bobby Joe Long reveal how his shocking crimes impacted the family. Were there any signs of his murderous intentions?.

programme.title: Embarrassing Fat Bodies
programme.desc: Pixie McKenna encounters three huge hernias, and Christian Jessen meets Malissa Jones, who, aged 18, became one of the youngest patients in Britain to undergo an operation to fit a gastric band in 2008.
